tweets.text:
claude code is having it's cursor moment after karpathy sensei's post. never been a better time to try it. 

my latest blog on how to get the most out of claude code 2.0  and other agents in general is up now. grab a chai and have fun reading!

https://t.co/cQpvo0xocY https://t.co/gzKCEMfEG6

tweets.text:
the claude agent sdk will do for knowledge work in 2026 what claude code did for coding in 2025.

want to live in the future?

build your own agents with it.

you‚Äôll have a personal magic tool belt that the public won‚Äôt have for another 6-12mo.

it 100% feels like personal agi.
tweets.author: @mckaywrigley

tweets.text:
you‚Äôre like 6 prompts away from infinitely customizable personal agi.

anthropic gave you a world class agentic harness for free.

use it!!! https://t.co/5ZJq7WlCTa
tweets.author: @mckaywrigley

tweets.text:
the ComputerUseTool is going to launch in the next few months and every high agency person who invested time in the agent sdk will basically become a demigod overnight.

the universe calls you to master the art of commanding armies of digital intelligences born from sand.

tweets.author: @mckaywrigley

tweets.author: @BodySpec

tweets.text:
my favorite way to use Claude Code to build large features is spec based

start with a minimal spec or prompt and ask Claude to interview you using the AskUserQuestionTool

then make a new session to execute the spec https://t.co/Lwejskje4a
tweets.author: @trq212

tweets.text: for big features or new projects Claude might ask me 40+ questions and I end up with a much more detailed spec that I feel I had a lot of control over
tweets.author: @trq212

tweets.text:
the prompt I've been using is:

read this @SPEC.md and interview me in detail using the AskUserQuestionTool about literally anything: technical implementation, UI & UX, concerns, tradeoffs, etc. but make sure the questions are not obvious

be very in-depth and continue
tweets.author: @trq212

tweets.text: @spec 7.5k bookmarks is crazy
tweets.author: @trq212

tweets.text: @trq212 @spec Do you make that spec in plan mode is are you natty with the first draft?
tweets.author: @AISloppyJoel

tweets.text:
@AISloppyJoel @spec lmao natty is crazy

but yeah I write the spec myself to start usually, but it doesn't have to be that long and this could easily just be a prompt instead
tweets.author: @trq212

tweets.text: @trq212 @spec how to install AskUserQuestion tool? Is it available by default?
tweets.author: @kn_neeraj1

tweets.text: @kn_neeraj1 @spec yup available by default!

It could also include an interactive startup prompt with suggestions to update skills/memory/rules allowing users to review, approve, or
tweets.author: @AnthonyOdie

tweets.author: @EightBitElon

tweets.text: @trq212 @spec What would be matching prompt to validate that feature is built correctly? Even after 40 questions/answers LLM can ignore everything you said, so how would we check?
tweets.author: @alex_mikhalev

tweets.text:
@trq212 @spec My flow is:
1. Prepare as detailed specification as I can
2. Ask Claude to review it and iteratively update it with me until there are no holes.

2nd part is very important since it avoids context problems if model is doing some research for me.

tweets.text:
LSP + hooks  + subagents + adversarial  validations  +  Ralph Wiggum loops + 2 way voice (stt/tts) loops is a magical 10x Claude Code experience. ü§Øüî•

Your default Claude Code harness is begging you to unhobble it.
tweets.author: @EricBuess

tweets.text: Not to mention self-referential command injection, context monitoring, auto restore from clear, compaction-avoidance, continuous work with frictionless context management, and validators to keep Claude honest and focused across many context clears in intelligent recurring loops.
tweets.author: @EricBuess

tweets.text: I should probably do a podcast or video at some point when things settle down. And maybe share a plugin example. It‚Äôs pretty wild. Coding via CarPlay with a project manager agent that intelligently queues tasks for later, merges them, keeps looping until validated. Just like
tweets.author: @EricBuess
